channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: U.S. Says Tren de Aragua Charges Will ‘Devastate’ Its Infrastructure
item.description: Federal prosecutors charged six members of the Venezuelan gang and 21 members of a violent splinter group.

item.title: A Coastal New England Town’s ‘Ornery’ Vandal: A Woodpecker
item.description: More than 20 vehicles in a town on Cape Ann, Mass., have been damaged by a woodpecker in mating season. “You still see him out here,” one resident sai...

item.title: Fed Chair Powell might have quietly won Trump’s one-sided war with the central bank after the president says he has ‘no intention’ of firing him
item.description: Powell might have escaped Trump's one-sided battle with the Fed unscathed.

item.title: Trump’s Trade War With China Puts Japan in a Tight Spot
item.description: Japan had long maintained deep economic ties with both China and the United States. Recent trade tensions may challenge that approach.

item.title: EU Fines Apple and Meta Total of $800 Million in First Use of Digital Competition Law
item.description: The European Commission said the Silicon Valley companies violated the Digital Markets Act, a law meant to crimp the power of the largest tech firms.

item.title: Pope Francis’ Coffin Is Moved to St. Peter’s Basilica to Lie in State
item.description: Crowds flocked to pay their respects and bid farewell to the pontiff, who died on Monday at the age of 88.

item.title: Marco Rubio unveils massive State Department overhaul that includes a 15% staff cut and the closure of 100 bureaus worldwide
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio unveiled a massive overhaul of the State Department as part of the Trump administration's “America First” mandate.

item.title: Exclusive: Chainguard secures $356 million Series D as valuation soars to $3.5 billion
item.description: Chainguard raises a $356 million Series D about nine months after announcing its Series C, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: Texas immigration lawyer, a U.S. citizen, in DHS mixup gets email telling him to leave immediately or risk deportation: ‘I just thought it was absurd’
item.description: Customs and Border Protection is quietly revoking two-year permits of people who used an online appointment app called CBP One, which brought in more ...

item.title: Greece—one of the few EU nations with a budget surplus last year—announces $1.15 billion in financial benefits
item.description: Greece’s surplus of 1.3% of GDP—compared to an overall EU deficit of 3.2%—was a marked improvement in financial performance for a country that was in ...

item.title: Pope Francis’ Coffin Is Moved to St. Peter’s Basilica to Lie in State
item.description: Crowds flocked to pay their respects and bid farewell to the pontiff, who died on Monday at the age of 88.

item.title: Catholics Expected a Revolution From Pope Francis, Just Not the One He Gave Them
item.description: Liberals hoped he’d ordain women or allow gay marriage. Conservatives thought he’d tear up Church doctrine. But his papacy favored debate over radical...

item.title: Map: 6.2-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Turkey
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Pope Francis’ Coffin Is Brought to St. Peter’s Basilica
item.description: A long procession carried the pope’s coffin from his residency at the Vatican to St. Peter’s Square, where crowds had gathered to pay their respects.

item.title: 3 Takeaways From The New York Times’ Interview With Syria’s New President
item.description: Ahmed al-Shara said his government was discussing military support with Russia and Turkey, appealed for a lifting of sanctions and suggested foreign f...
